sub_title: Lectures & Workshops on the Bible and English Literature subjects
summary:
I am a graduate of Weequahic High School (Newark, New Jersey, USA, 1961), Bard College (BA  Eng. Lit. 1965), the Johns Hopkins University (MA  Eng. lit. 1966) and the University of Connecticut (Ph.d  Eng. lit.1979).

During my 45 year long teaching career I have covered the gamut of English literature from Chaucer to the present day. My Ph.d research field was Alexander Pope and the whole period of English satire from 1688 to 1745. I also developed and taught  advanced undergraduate courses at the University of Amsterdam on "Continuity and Innovation in American Poetry" and "Jewish-American Literature in the Post-War Period." 

Since my early retirement in 2005 I have been concentrating on teaching two different courses which reflect my current interest in the Torah (Old Testament) to Senior Citizens at two of Holland's universities, namely the Free University (Amsterdam) and the University of Groningen. The first of these courses is called "The Jacob Principle: Symbol, Ritual and Theme in the Jewish Bible" and the second is called "From Gift to Command: How Monotheism, Idolatry, the Family Metaphor and the Contract Metaphor Together Shaped the Jewish Bible."

I hope some day to turn "The Jacob Principle" into a book.

Specialties: American literature: Bernard Malamud
English literature: Alexander Pope
Other: Bible Study and Theology

awards.title: State of Connecticut Pre-Doctoral Fellowship, 1970
awards.description: Upon finishing my prelims for a Ph.d. in English literature on the English poet, Alexander Pope, I was awarded a State of Connecticut fellowship to support me while writing my dissertation on the subject.

awards.title: Leopold Schepp Scholar
awards.description: From 1961 until my graduation in 1965 I was a Leopold Schepp Scholar while attending Bard College.

profile_positions.description:
Since 2009 I have been teaching courses on various aspects of the Old and New Testaments to adult students at the HOVO, VU University Amsterdam . Past courses have been "Het Jakob Principe: Symbol, Ritueel en Thema in de Joodse Bijbel"​;'​"Van Geschenk tot Gebod: hoe monotheïsme, afgoderij, gezin en contract samen de basis legden voor de Joodse Bijbel"​; "De engel en de droom: engelen in het Jodendom"​; "Een spiegel voor de ziel: zes thema's uit de Thora"​ (de verbanning uit Eden en de kwestie van zonde, de betekenis van het thema van de onvruchtbare vrouw in de Thora, magie in de Thora, het boek Esther, de profeet Elia, de Psalms als leerschool) en "Rasji's Licht: zes thema's uit de Thora"​ (Rasji's vertaling van Genesis 1:1, de betekenis van heiligheid in Leviticus 19, het verhaal van Bileam, de positie van de niet-jood in de Thora, 'Was Jeremia werkelijk aan het jeremieëren? en de twee puzzelstukken van het boek Ruth). Een nieuwe stuk is 'Wat mankeert Noach?: de rabbijnen, de christelijke interpretatie en de visie van de Documentary Hypothesis.'​

In addition, I have so far also taught three course on English literature for the HOVO at VU University Amsterdam, one on the subject of the modern English playwright, Harold Pinter, another on Geoffrey Chaucer's "The Canterbury Tales"​ and a third on "Romantic Revolution in the Poetry of Blake, Wordsworth, Coleridge and the Second Generation Romantics (Shelley, Keats and Byron)."
profile_positions.title: Docent Bible and English literature

company.name: Freelance Lecturer on Torah and New Testament

profile_positions.company: Freelance Lecturer on Torah and New Testament
profile_positions.description:
For more than 20 years I have been giving lectures and workshops all over the Netherlands.on various aspects of Judaism and the Torah to various chapters of the Genootschap Nederland-Israel as well as to many different church groups and theological institutes. Some of the topics covered have been the symbolic meaning of the twins Jacob and Esau, the concept of monotheism, the family and contract metaphors, the question of sin in the story of the expulsion from Eden, the meaning of the theme of the infertile woman, the rights of animals, the  peace-war contradiction in the Torah the relationship of the story of David to the book of Ruth, and the various interpretations of the story of Noah. 

More recently, I have also presented Jewish approaches to some of the  parables of the New Testament, concentrating on the Parable of the Sower and on the famous parable of the Prodigal Son. All of these lectures have been presented in the Dutch language!
profile_positions.title: Torah Lecturer

profile_positions.description: During this period of 30 years I taught all subjects related to English and American literature with a particular emphasis on satire (Dryden, Pope and Swift), Jewish-American literature and research methods and the philosophy of interpretation.
profile_positions.title: Docent English and American Literature, retired

profile_positions.description: My first full time position was at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem in a department headed by Prof. Ruth Nevo.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer, English & American Literature

volunteer_experiences.role: I am listed here as a coach for 'brugklaasers,' as a language coach and as a tour guide in Abcoude.
volunteer_experiences.description: So far I have only done voluntary work as a language coach teaching Dutch to newcomers.

Stichting Vrij (Amsterdam) organizers visits to prisoners who otherwise would receive none. Besides visiting prisoners, I am also the author of the rule-book governing the operation of the Stichting's "Buddy Project" for befriending and helping released prisoners. I  have been active as a volunteer for this organization since 2003,

company.name: English teacher at Achtsprong elementary school, Amsterdam-Bijlmermeer (Stichting Bijzonderwijs. Am)

volunteer_experiences.description: Since November, 2014 I have been volunteering as a teacher of 8th grade English to a class of 30 pupils from many different countries that is located in a multicultural district of Amsterdam.

skills: English as Second Language for 8th Graders
